meanings.definition: To cause someone to fall from a horse.
meanings.sent1: The sudden movement of the horse resulted in unhorsing the rider.
meanings.sent2: The knight was skilled at unhorsing his opponents in jousting tournaments.
meanings.sent3: During the comical play, the clumsy character kept unintentionally unhorsing himself.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected news about the storm unhorsed her like a powerful force.
meanings.sent5: The image of the cowboy unhorsing the bandit was etched in his memory.

meanings.definition: To remove someone from a position of power or authority.
meanings.sent1: The scandalous revelation led to unhorsing the corrupt politician from office.
meanings.sent2: The board of directors decided to unhorse the CEO due to financial mismanagement.
meanings.sent3: The cunning rival plotted to unhorse the current leader in the upcoming election.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected resignation unhorsed the entire management team, causing chaos.
meanings.sent5: The whistleblower's evidence was the key to unhorsing the dishonest official.
